events.event_name: Bank of England Interest Rate Decision
events.description: The Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75% but signaled a dovish stance.

events.event_name: Appointment of Peter Mandelson as UK ambassador to the US
events.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer appointed Peter Mandelson, leading to political uncertainty.

facts.fact_text: UK 10-year gilt yields fell to 4.55% in afternoon trade.

evidences.evidence_text: UK 10-year gilt yields fell to 4.55% in afternoon trade

facts.fact_text: The Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75%.

evidences.evidence_text: the Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75%

facts.fact_text: Four of nine MPC members voted for a 25 basis point rate cut.

evidences.evidence_text: four of nine MPC members favoring an immediate 25 basis point cut to 3.5%

facts.fact_text: Gilt yields reached a three-month high of 4.612% earlier in the session.

evidences.evidence_text: Earlier in the session, gilt yields had reached an over three-month high of 4.612%

claims.claim_text: The Bank of England signaled a more dovish stance than markets had expected.

evidences.evidence_text: signaled a more dovish stance than markets had expected

claims.claim_text: CPI inflation will return toward the 2% target from April.
claims.author: MPC members

evidences.evidence_text: expectations that CPI inflation will return toward the 2% target from April

claims.claim_text: Risks from persistent inflation have eased.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: The Bank highlighted that risks from persistent inflation have eased

claims.claim_text: Weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced.
claims.author: Bank of England

evidences.evidence_text: while weaker demand and a softening labor market have become more pronounced

evidence.evidence_text: UK 10-year gilt yields fell to 4.55%... after the Bank of England kept interest rates unchanged at 3.75% but signaled a more dovish stance
gilt yields had reached an over three-month high of 4.612%, driven by rising political uncertainty after Prime Minister Keir Starmer appointed Peter Mandelson
